Andrey Semyonovitch sighed. 

"And you really believe in progress?" 

Pyotr Petrovitch smirked. 

"Of course. Itâ€™s fashionable." 

Andrey frowned. 

"You mock me." 

Pyotr waved a hand dismissively. 

"You're just a simpleton." 

Andrey felt the sting of truth. 

"Am I a fool for believing?" 

Pyotr chuckled. 

"Beliefs are for the naive." 

Andrey's heart sank. 

He realized Pyotr despised him. 

"You're not the right sort of man," he muttered. 

Pyotr's laughter echoed. 

Andrey turned away, feeling lost.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pyotr Petrovitch is depicted as a duplicitous character who secretly despises Andrey Semyonovitch while feigning interest in progressive ideas.
